medical_history.chief_complaint: Episodic neuroglycopenic hypoglycemia suspected to be due to insulinoma.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began one year prior to presentation, characterized by recurrent intermittent episodes of confusion and dizziness that improved with candy. An emergency admission followed an episode of altered mental status and slurred speech, revealing a blood glucose level of 39 mg/dL.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history of depression, hyperlipidemia, cholecystectomy, and remote smoking history.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal history of breast and colon cancer; no family history of endocrine neoplasms.
